newsitem.title: DUBAI: Iran to stage wargame surprise attacks on "enemies".
newsitem.headline: Iran to stage wargame surprise attacks on "enemies".

text.p: Iranian forces will stage amphibious wargames in the Gulf next week to train for surprise attacks against "enemies" posing threats to the Islamic republic, Iran's official news agency IRNA said on Tuesday.

It quoted Revolutionary Guards Commander General Mohsen Rezaei as saying 200,000 troops and volunteer Bassij forces would take part in the manoeuvres code-named "Tariq-ol Qods" (Road to Jerusalem). He did not say when exactly the wargames would start.

Stretching from the northern Gulf to the Gulf of Oman, the wargames will test the defensive tactics and the ability of the forces to "catch enemies by surprise in the event of potential threats to Iran", Rezaei said.

Iran regularly holds wargames in the Gulf. Tehran has rejected Western media reports that it was linked to a bombing in Saudi Arabia in June which killed 19 U.S. airmen and some Iranian officials have said the reports indicated that Washington was preparing to attack Iran.
Rezaei last year warned Israel and the United States against aggressive moves, saying Iran would retaliate strongly throughout the Gulf.
